TextView.android:text: Habits is a 21 day program where you set out to complete 6 habits every day. The expectation is to complete 4 to 5 of these every day. If you miss a day, do not perform a habit-slip compensation (fancy phrase for 'punishment') where you, for example, try to over-perform the next day to make up for the missed day. At the end of the journey, you go on auto-pilot to see what sticks! The 21 day 6 habit technique here is based on renowned neuroscientist Andrew Huberman's directions. You can find out more on Youtube: 'The Science of Making and Breaking Habits| Huberman Lab Podcast #53' According to Huberman, this technique may be extremely useful in achieving context independent, less-limbic-frictitious habit formation. Basically means that it's a great way to form habits. The habits you choose can range from a simple thing like waking up a certain time of day, to challenging tasks such as heavy-weight workouts. The aim is to promote neuroplasticity. Any habit is a habit! After the journey, do not set out to do 6 new habits. Examine how many of your habits that you initially set out to perform have become a natural part of your daily process, in other words, a habit of yours. I hope you like what you might find out about yourself! -Fuat
